text: Assaria is a city in Saline County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 428 people lived there. ==History== Assaria was planned out in 1879. The first post office in Assaria was created in September 1879. ==Geography== Assaria is at (38.680203, -97.604142). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== It is part of the Salina Micropolitan Statistical Area. ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 428 people, 169 households, and 117 families living in Assaria. Of the households, 83.4% owned their home and 16.6% rented their home. The median age was 40.7 years. Of the people, 95.8% were White, 0.7% were Black, 0.9% were from some other race, and 2.6% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 3.7% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 413 people, 159 households, and 122 families living in Assaria. ==Education== Assaria is served by USD 306 Southeast of Saline.Saline County School District Map ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Assaria - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 306 , local school district ;Historical * Renaissance Cafe, in former 1919 Assaria High School * , from Hatteberg's People on KAKE TV news ;Maps * Assaria City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Saline County, Kansas Category:1879 establishments in Kansas
title: Assaria, Kansas
